item.title: Adding Rows to a Grid in ExtJS 4.1
item.description: Note: Has been updated for ExtJS 4.1 In the last article we built a data grid mockup in ExtJS 4.1. Now we want to add some rows to the grid. Firstly we need to create a model class to store a data. We’ve done that also in the previously article, but for the better understanding, here’s it again: Ext.define('Person', { extend: 'Ext.data.Model', fields: ['firstName', 'lastName'] }); Having the Person class we can simply add new rows to the store (people in our case) by calling the add function with new instances of that class:
